page.title: 13SCOTTS HOSPITAL HUNTLY
page.content: Scotts Hospital is a home for old people. They have rooms to themselves which have a bed, wardrobe, dressing table, table and chairs. Their meals are provided. There is one sitting room for the lady's and one for the men. The men and women are seperate. They are at different sides of the Hospital. At dinner a loud noise can be heard. They all have different dinner hours. Scotts Hospital has about 35 residents and 25 staff. The nurses have to dress, wash and sometimes feed the old people. One nurse has to stay over night when the matron is away. They are busiest in the morning from 7.30 to 9.00 am. Mrs Shields has stayed there for two years. She does not get up the street. They get very good meals. The nurses arrange trips for them. She is very happy there.
